name: To the moon, Alice!
description:
Nasir has been quite the fun challenge. I kinda feel like Kate is just better, but he's fun to win with. He makes running more interesting, which is always good.

Notable Inclusions: The Personal Touch: Boy did I ever underestimate this card. It is truly amazing and saves you a ton of money over the long game.

Pipleline: Never thought I'd be using this breaker. But it's been strong, killing sentries like nobody's business. Run into a strength 2 and throw a Personal Touch on it. Or just Femme larger sentries.

Motivation/Oracle May - Another random thing I never thought I'd include in a deck, but it turns out to be quite the amazing draw/econ engine. I'm a big fan.

Parasite - Strictly in here for Chimera. Chimera single-handedly shuts the deck down, so it's a must-include unfortunately. SMCs are in here to tutor it up, and Clone Chip gets it back. Plus it has the added benefit of just being a good program to kill weak ice with.

Personal Workshop - This is probably obvious to most, but it's just a great econ engine that works well with Nasir's on-the-fly credits. A great include. Though I'm thinking of going to 2.

Other Notes: I have had great success with the deck, but it has required constant refinement over the course of it's existence. I may be getting a little greedy with the 2 Legworks. I think trading them for more Stimhacks and a Corroder may be in order. Tell me what you think!

name: NEH Tag/Horizontal
Tennin Reviewed
description: Not my decklist, adapted one. Will give the link and details later. Works very well...

name: Control Stirling
description:
My latest attempt at making a viable Stirling deck.

The early game is focused on getting Mr. Li and Logos down.

Mid game will have you searching for 1 Access to Globalsec and every copy of Underworld Contact. This is also a good time to get a Crypsis down to threaten any agenda they'd like to score.

In the late game, both players will likely have lots of credits but you should have more. Now is the time to Vamp it all away. With no safe place to score an agenda, finish the game off using John Masanori and Data Leak Reversal

Ideally, The Source should be played after they score their first agenda and should be replaced after use or saved with Fall Guy. Don't be afraid to Data Dealer your agendas away; you often don't need them to win.

If you choose to bring something like this to a tournament, be mindful of the time limit. Even when playing at a quick pace, this will take a while.

name: GottaGOfast
description: Can't stop, won't stop, don't stop.

name: Core + C&C EtF
description: An HB glacier deck. Uses only 1 core set and Creation & Control.

name: Core + C&C Gabe
description: A classic Gabe parasite deck. Uses only 1 core set and Creation & Control.

name: No Core Andromeda
description: Sample runner deck for Seg Fault restrictions.

name: Corporate Prostitution
Blackguard Reina
The Android Snitch 1.0
description:
This is a simple single-core Weyland deck built around the SEA Source + 2x Scorched Earth combo. I have included Project Junebug, which has some surprise effect in a Weyland deck.

The name is inspired by a nice possible combo with a single Scorched Earth in hand. Score Private Security Force early in the game and, later on, flatline the runner using Biotic Labor + SEA Source + a single Scorched Earth, spending the last two clicks activating PSF. It is not easy, but I have pulled it off twice already, to great effect.

The deck is not optimized and I am working on a second version of it.

name: Nasir Deck?
description: My crack at a Nasir Deck....

name: Near Earth Hub: Quick Draw
description:
Just another (yawn) astrobiotic deck. It's super fast, super mean and wins most games. Pieces all work well independently and are amazing when you put them together.

The whole deck is modular, you can score an AstroScript Pilot Program by Biotic Labor, Fast Track Biotic Labor onto a SanSan City Grid, dropping it behind a Lotus Field and scoring it the hard way or even just naked drop letting them think it's just another Marked Accounts or PAD Campaign. You also don't need money to score because of Shipment from Sansan. So if you don't get ice early, keeping low credits is a legitimate way to deter siphons.

With the drip economy that ALSO gives you draw this deck is stupid powerful. Lots of money, lots of things to waste the runners time, and all the pieces you need for one of the fastest decks I've seen.

The ice is simple. Lotus Field on your most vulnerable server. Pop-up Window for early econ, plugging holes with more serious ice after they start scoring. Chimera on HQ to prevent siphons or on a remote for an early AstroScript Pilot Program. Wraparound to mess up Atman. And Rototurret to kill key breakers if you can get it off.

name: Boom & Bust
description:
I've been working on this Nasir build for a bit, and was able to get a few games in at league night. I went with an R&D lock build, with the ability to get in where needed late game. Nasir poses some interesting problems to late game, once a majority of the corps ICE is rezzed, so I included Magnum Opus as a burst credit generator for late game. Kati Jones should be used early to keep a pile of credits safe while Nasir's pool fluctuates wildly.

Breaker wise, I went with a rig that can bump their strength before Nasir loses credits and they keep that strength for the rest of the run. This should allow me to break most ICE even when running with low credits.

I went with The Toolbox as the console, but Dinosaurus may be a good alternative. Beyond that its fairly standard. Places for Nasir to drop credits before they vanish, Imp to trash assets and agendas he might not have credits for by the end of a run. Parasite to get rid of the popups, pups, etc by using a clone chip before encountering them.

Parasite is there to be hosted on Personal Workshop or brought in via Clone Chip during a run. You destroy PopUps, Pups, and other problematic ice after the rez, but before the encounter. Keeping your credit pool intact.

From the few games i have played, this has been a super fun deck that makes the runner and the corp play very differently. It helps to have a run timing chart on hand, as people who haven't seen him before will have plenty of questions.

name: Le artiste Kit
description: Inspired by Run Last Click, I've been playing with Kit. I have no idea how standard or oddball this is, but I've played it a couple dozen times and it's working pretty well (for me). Econ is pretty simple, with test runs and moddeds to help get the toys out so I can spend my money on runs. I also helps get my breakers out in the first or second turn, which is key. Kit needs to run every turn to keep the corp sucking for creds (crescentus helps), recursion keeps my toys in play and events (especially legwork) gets me agendas when they don't expect it). Same with tinkering. Let me know what you all think.

name: Reina
Weyland: Power You Can Rely On
Near Earth Orbit
description: The Astrotrain is leaving the station after receiving some upgrades and now has a whole nother passanger car filled to the brim with HB roid-workers.

name: Blue Sun Barriers
description:
I have no idea if this is a viable deck, but it's been knocking around my head all morning. Here it is. I figure this is the best way to take advantage of Superior Cyberwalls.

Quandary and Rototurret are for stopping runs and/or removing their Fracter when they realize the Barrier Density. I expect Power Shutdown to be important as well.

name: Elmer's Glue
description: Messing around with Nasir. I'm already convinced that Overmind+Nasir is a good investment, but I'm not sure which accompanying cards are best with it yet. This is a RND Lock style Overmind build that wants to get all ice on RND rezzed so that it can pillage. It uses Crescentus to derez ICE on HQ to keep the corp poor.

name: Running Quest
I'll take you to the Nasir Shop
Harm Money 2.2 - GP July '14 Tournament
description: The idea is to score a quick 3 pointer that was advanced 4 times with Mushin. Runners are then forced to run then and bad things happen.

name: Krispy Whizzard 1.2 - GP July '14 Tournament
description: Get Donut out. Run as much as possible. Pro Con is to help with all the drawing.

name: Big Three
description: Set up the biggest rig and run freely.

name: Kate Morningstar
Runless Noise
description:
A concept deck inspired by this reddit post http://www.reddit.com/r/Netrunner/comments/2cqhjz/therunlesswin/.

The plan is to install viruses to mill the corp down, then win with Hades Shard.

name: Burning Moon v1.3
